title: New Generation of Theater Troupes to Get a Boost
summary: Theatre Row will launch an initiative to bring five new companies to its West 42nd Street home. For years, the stretch of 42nd Street between Ninth and Tenth avenues has been home to some of New York City's best-known off-Broadway theater troupes, including Playwrights Horizons and Signature Theatre Company.

title: After Biting Report, Providence Looks to Lift Failing School District
summary: 'I can't accept this for any kid,' new state education commissioner says after devastating report. PROVIDENCE, R.I.-Brown tap water. Student brawls. Chronically absent teachers. Test scores that rank among the worst in the country.

title: U.S. to Probe France's Digital Tax
summary: French proposal will apply a 3% tax on revenue that big technology companies reap in France. U.S. trade officials are launching a probe of France's planned tax on digital services, kicking off a spat with Paris as well as a global fight over how to tax the growing internet economy.

title: Venture Funds See 9% Surge in First-Half Fundraising
summary: Wealth managers flock to venture capital as interest rates remain low and more startups go public. U.S. venture-capital firms continued to bring in large cash hauls for new funds, as limited partners sought to gain positions in the next big technology giants.

title: New Lease Accounting Standard May Mislead Investors, Credit Suisse Says
summary: Report says data-feed errors are potentially having a negative impact on investment decisions. New lease accounting rules have resulted in potentially misleading data feeds, inconsistent financial reporting and other discrepancies that could confuse and misinform investors, Credit Suisse Group analysts said in one of the more detailed industry warnings from an investment bank since the standard took effect for public companies late last year.

title: Pelosi's Sharp Words Applauded by House Democrats
summary: Many lawmakers say they welcome House speaker's efforts to tamp down infighting in her caucus. WASHINGTON-House Speaker Nancy Pelosi has spent the better part of the week sending sharp messages to her liberal critics on and off Capitol Hill. So far, it appears most House Democrats-including many freshmen-are taking her side.

title: Joe Biden, S-Corp Millionaire
summary: The Trump economy sure is working for the former Vice President.. Nearly every Democrat running for President is using the stock line that the U.S. economy "isn't working for average Americans." Last week we showed why that wasn't true. And we now know it certainly is working for Joe Biden, as the release of his tax returns this week shows.

title: Why Vietnam Loves Donald Trump
summary: Tariffs are changing supply chains, not cutting the trade deficit.. Thirty months into the Trump Presidency, the U.S. economy continues to import more than it exports. This isn't a problem, since the trade deficit is of no great consequence as an economic measure. But in President Trump's telling this is a clear and present danger, so it's worth explaining why his tariffs haven't reduced the U.S. trade deficit with the world.

title: A Not So Special Relationship
summary: Everyone loses as President Trump feuds with Britain's envoy.. As so often happens these days, everyone's a loser in the matter of President Trump's feud with Britain's Ambassador to the U.S. Must it always be this way in the Trump-Brexit era?

title: Kamala Harris's Debate Victory Proves Pyrrhic
summary: She got the better of Biden, but in a way that wrecks her reputation for decency, character and truthfulness.. Memories of the first Democratic debates recede, though echoes remain of one bizarrely magnified event-Sen. Kamala Harris's sustained assault on front-runner Joe Biden. Over the weekend Mr. Biden issued an apology to those who had been pained when he recalled his amicable relations with archsegregationists early in his Senate days. Ms. Harris's response made it clear that she had no intention of allowing that night of glory on the debate stage to fade-a moment that changed the world and her place in it, according to a fevered commentariat.

title: Make Central America Great Again
summary: To stanch the flow of illegal aliens, pour U.S. foreign aid into improving their home countries.. Illegal immigration from the Northern Triangle of El Salvador, Guatemala and Honduras is understandable. If you were there, you would leave too. Aliens often come for the economic opportunities in the U.S., and many times are fleeing crime and violence. President Trump has urged the three countries to stop this illegal migration, but it is doubtful that they have the capacity to do so on their own.

title: Trump, Brexit and the Former Ambassador
summary: Were Russians behind the leaks of Darroch's cables? Or could it have been a backer of Boris Johnson?. London

title: The Democrats Go to Extremes
summary: The radicalism of the primary campaign will bite the party's 2020 nominee.. Helped by the secretive Italian firm Simul Viator Muneris to gain access to the Quantum Realm, I recently traveled to Nov. 2, 2020, to the Democratic presidential nominee's final election rally. Here is a partial transcript of that speech:

title: Wahooing Betsy Ross
summary: What's striking about Colin Kaepernick's Nike sneaker ban is how easy it was.. The remarkable thing about Colin Kaepernick's banning of Nike 's Betsy Ross flag sneaker to commemorate the Fourth of July isn't that it happened, but how easily it happened. Nike's management simply folded over "concerns that it could unintentionally offend."

title: Ross Perot's Educational Legacy
summary: Without his support, Teach For America might not exist.. I reached out to Ross Perot in the spring of 1990. It was a long shot, but he agreed to let me come in to pitch my proposal in person. Thanks to that meeting, Teach For America was able to launch.

title: 'The Truffle Underground' Review: Malice and Mushrooms
summary: The truffle industry is rife with crime and corruption, ranging from false marketing to the kidnapping of truffle-hunting dogs.. In May 2017, class-action lawsuits filed in New York and California accused the grocery chain Trader Joe's, among other companies, of fraud. The complaint argued that the defendants misled consumers with their so-called truffle oil products, which don't contain truffles but instead a petroleum-based chemical that presents a fair if slightly benzeneous-tasting imitation of the natural truffle smell and costs about 40 cents to produce enough for an 8-ounce bottle.

title: Judge Orders PG&E to Respond to Journal Article
summary: The company has until July 31 to file a 'fresh, forthright statement'. A federal judge on Wednesday ordered PG&E Corp. to respond, "on a paragraph-by-paragraph basis," to a Wall Street Journal article that said the company has failed to upgrade hundreds of miles of high-voltage power lines despite knowing they could fail and spark wildfires.

title: U.K. Ambassador to U.S. Quits Over Leak Furor
summary: Move comes days after U.K. newspaper published the leaked views of the ambassador about Trump, prompting biting criticism from the U.S. president. Britain's ambassador to the U.S. said he would resign over the diplomatic firestorm caused by the leak of secret cables in which he criticized President Trump's administration as dysfunctional.

title: Videogames and Two-Day Delivery Powered the S&P's Rise to 3000
summary: Oil companies were among the laggards, reflecting that crude prices haven't fully recovered. Tech stocks including Amazon.com Inc. and Netflix Inc. led the pack during the S&P 500's half-decade march from 2000 to 3000, while oil companies were among the laggards.

title: Parents Sue Over Ban on Religious Exemptions for Vaccinations
summary: Plaintiffs' lawyers include Robert F. Kennedy Jr., chairman of an antivaccination group. The first of several anticipated lawsuits challenging a recently passed New York state law that eliminated religious exemptions from school-vaccination rules was filed Wednesday in Albany.

title: Berkshire Hathaway's Benjamin Moore to Become Main Paint Supplier for Ace Hardware
summary: Deal is a setback for Sherwin-Williams, which will continue to sell some products at Ace. Ace Hardware Corp. said it is making Berkshire Hathaway Inc.'s Benjamin Moore its main paint supplier, pushing paint made by Sherwin-Williams Co. out of its thousands of U.S. home-improvement stores.

title: Joint Chiefs Nominee Hyten Cleared of Sex Allegations
summary: It isn't known if the investigation will affect the nomination for the Pentagon's next No. 2 officer. WASHINGTON-Air Force officials found no evidence of wrongdoing by Gen. John Hyten, the nominee to be the next vice chairman of the Pentagon's Joint Chiefs of Staff, after investigating allegations of sexual misconduct levied against him by a female service member, officials said.

title: Trump Administration Hasn't Briefed Congress on New Cyberattack Rules, Lawmakers Say
summary: Some lawmakers are concerned they lack oversight of the military's increasing use of cyber weapons. WASHINGTON-The Trump administration hasn't allowed members of Congress to read a classified directive President Trump issued almost a year ago outlining new rules for the military's use of cyber weapons, despite repeated requests, according to lawmakers and others familiar with the matter.

title: Macron's Staying Power Tested by French Mayoral Races
summary: In search of local roots, president leans toward loyalists as party picks candidates for 2020 campaigns. PARIS-French President Emmanuel Macron's party chose dozens of candidates to run in local elections next year, a critical step toward establishing strong local roots, particularly in areas that gave rise to the volatile yellow-vest movement.

title: Congress Presses for More Details About Acosta's Role in Epstein Plea Deal
summary: Labor secretary renews defense of his involvement in 2008 sex-abuse case as House Democrats ask him to testify. Labor Secretary Alexander Acosta gave an expanded defense of his handling of a controversial plea agreement, as Republican lawmakers joined Democrats in scrutinizing the former federal prosecutor's 2008 role in a Florida sex-abuse case against financier Jeffrey Epstein.

title: Gulf States Brace for Potential Hurricane
summary: Floodwaters already make several New Orleans neighborhoods impassable. NEW ORLEANS-Unrelenting rain caused flooding in several parts of the city, while a larger threat loomed over the Gulf of Mexico.

title: Democrats Will Stop Raising their Hands
summary: New polling and new concerns about the strange ideas endorsed in Miami.. In last month's Democratic debates, a remarkable number of presidential candidates raised their hands in support of unpopular ideas. Will voters punish them for it?

title: Rice Brothers Win Control of EQT
summary: Gas producer's shareholders elect all seven directors nominated by Rice group. Two brothers who sought control of natural-gas producer EQT Corp. have succeeded in their campaign.

title: New York City Officials Propose Designs for 'Modern Jails'
summary: Plan to close Rikers Island moves into next phase of approval process. The four jails that New York City wants to build to replace its Rikers Island facility will have cells with natural sunlight, space for programming and a children's play area, officials said Wednesday.

title: New York Celebrates World Cup-Winning U.S. Women's Team
summary: Ticker-tape parade doubles as rally for equal pay; fans chant 'pay them' throughout ceremony. The U.S. women's soccer team was celebrated with a parade and given keys to New York City on Wednesday, as fans and officials kept up the call for equal pay.

title: Levi Strauss Shares Fall on Smaller Profit, Second-Half Sales Outlook
summary: Jeans maker sees growth across all of its brands, but IPO costs hurt earnings. Levi Strauss & Co. said costs related to its initial public offering hurt profit in the latest quarter, and the jeans maker expects sales growth to moderate.

title: Home-Improvement Stocks Hammered Amid Powell Comments
summary: Fed chairman offers cloudy outlook for U.S. economy in testimony to Congress. Planning to remodel your kitchen or build that new patio? Investors fear that homeowners are putting those projects on hold, after parsing comments by Federal Reserve Chairman Jerome Powell.

title: Trump Makes Fresh Threats Against Iran Over Its Nuclear Program
summary: Latest push comes during new diplomatic effort to isolate Tehran. President Trump made fresh threats to ramp up U.S. sanctions against Iran for stepping up its enrichment of uranium, tweeting that America's response "will soon be increased, substantially."

title: Stocks Leap to Records Following Powell's Comments
summary: Nasdaq closes at highest level ever; S&P 500 briefly crosses 3000. U.S. stocks leapt Wednesday after Federal Reserve Chairman Jerome Powell set the stage for the central bank to cut interest rates to bolster flagging growth.

title: Iron-Ore Prices Have Surged Almost 70%, Hitting Steelmakers
summary: Rally is so painful in China that country's steel companies have urged government to try to calm the market. Iron-ore prices have soared 67% this year, a resurgence driven by falling supplies that has led to challenging times once again for steel mills that use the material.

summary: A starry tennis pairing makes an entertaining run in mixed doubles. Wimbledon, England

title: Former Puerto Rico Officials Are Accused of Corruption

U.S. authorities indicted the former heads of Puerto Rico's education department and health-insurance agency under Gov. Ricardo Rosselló, alleging they steered government contracts to favored businesses.

title: Columbia's Jeffrey Sachs Proposes Coffee Fund to Help Poor Farmers
summary: Fund would invest $10 billion a year and focus on social protection, improved efficiencies. CAMPINAS, Brazil-The world's coffee farmers are suffering because of low prices on global markets, but a fund investing $10 billion a year in helping the poorest improve efficiency and increasing their access to health care and education would boost their standard of living, Columbia University Professor Jeffrey Sachs said Wednesday.

title: Harvard Sanctions Star Economist Fryer for Sex-Harassment Violations
summary: Roland Fryer Jr. allegedly engaged in unwelcome sexual conduct over several years; his research lab will be shuttered. Harvard University placed famed economist Roland Fryer Jr. on a two-year administrative leave on Wednesday after determining he had violated the school's sexual-harassment policy by engaging in inappropriate behavior involving multiple individuals.

title: P&G CIO Says He Wants to Hire More Women Coders
summary: Javier Polit is the first CIO named to the board of Girls Who Code, a nonprofit aimed at closing the gender gap in science and tech. Girls Who Code, a nonprofit that educates young women in computer science, has added a chief information officer to its board for the first time.

summary: Resume Subscription. The Journal is a podcast about money, business and power, hosted by Kate Linebaugh and Ryan Knutson. The Journal is a co-production from Gimlet Media and The Wall Street Journal.

title: New Shelter for Migrant Teenagers Lacks Residents
summary: Operator admits facility is 'too much, too late' following outcry over conditions for kids in Border Patrol cells. CARRIZO SPRINGS, Texas-A new shelter for migrant teenagers who crossed the border alone in this small Texas town is only 10% full and the contractor running it concedes it may be "too much, too late."

title: Fed's Bullard Leans Toward Rate Cut at July Fed Meeting
summary: St. Louis Fed President favors quarter-percentage-point rate cut at next meeting. Federal Reserve Bank of St. Louis President James Bullard said Wednesday that based on where the economy is now he still favors a quarter-percentage-point rate cut when policy makers meet at the end of the month.

title: 'Purple Mountains' Review: A Poet of Comic Desperation
summary: David Berman, formerly of the indie rock band Silver Jews, returns after a 10-year hiatus with a new band, and his lyrics remain idiosyncratic marvels of wrenching, wry hilarity..

Real-estate giant Realogy Holdings Corp. filed a lawsuit Wednesday against rival Compass, alleging that the startup brokerage firm engaged in unfair and illegal practices to gain market share and damage competitors.

title: Gov. Cuomo Signs Bills Aimed at Closing New York's Gender Wage Gap
summary: One bill would prohibit questions about a job applicant's salary history, the other expands existing law to require equal pay for 'substantially similar work'. Against the backdrop of a parade celebrating the World Cup victory of the U.S. women's soccer team, Gov. Andrew Cuomo signed two bills Wednesday that he said will close the pay gap between men and women.

title: Oil Hits Seven-Week High on Falling Supplies
summary: U.S. Energy Information Administration data mark fourth straight week of falls in U.S. crude stocks. Oil prices climbed to a seven-week high Wednesday on a combination of falling U.S. inventories and risks to supply in the U.S. and Middle East.

title: Hate Crimes Are Real and They're Increasing
summary: The FBI reported 7,175 hate crimes in 2017-a 17% jump from 2016. There was a notable 37% spike in crimes targeting Jews and Jewish institutions.. Jason Riley's suggestion that false hate crimes are being amplified by civil-rights organizations and others who "have a vested interest in exaggerating racial tensions" is deeply offensive and flat-out wrong ("Hate Crime Hoaxes Are More Common Than You Think," Upward Mobility, June 26). This argument is the ultimate red herring when one considers the documented rising number of bias-motivated crimes in America and their toll on individual victims and entire communities.

title: The Issue Is Near-Eternal Plastic Containers
summary: Companies are using a material made to last forever to produce products designed to be used once and then thrown away.. Beverage companies seem to be doing everything they can to distract us with recycling efforts, but none of this will save our oceans ("Shortage of Recycled Plastic Hits Beverage Companies," Business News, July 1). While corporations are busy making recycling promises, plastic production is skyrocketing. It's expected to increase at least fourfold between 2014 and 2050. Meanwhile, only 9% of all the plastic waste ever generated has actually been recycled. At this point, betting on recycling is like trying to mop water from an already overflowing bathtub while you're also opening the faucet more.

title: 'One People' Not Helped by Divisive Politics
summary: We don't have to go back to the 20th century to point to "fear" among politicians about Catholicism.. Regarding William A. Galston's "What Makes Americans One People?" (Politics & Ideas, July 3): We don't have to go back to the 20th century to point to "fear" among politicians about Catholicism. Perhaps it applies to journalists as well?

title: R.I.P. Mad Magazine, a Publication of Integrity
summary: William Gaines made fun of everything in sight via Mad.. Regarding the July 6 Notable and Quotable from Brian Doherty on Mad magazine: Before he founded Mad magazine, William Gaines published crime-themed comic books. In the mid-1950s these comics were being blamed for what used to be called "juvenile delinquency." What better way to protect the youth of the day than by having an investigative hearing before a U.S. Senate committee (investigative hearing being political code then and now for grabbing headlines on an issue about which the Senate will do absolutely nothing)?

title: Where Is Equal Justice and Freedom in Portland, Ore.?
summary: During the end of the dark days known as the Jim Crow era, federal authorities intervened to protect civil-rights demonstrators in the South and prosecuted white Democrats there who denied police protection to peaceful protesters.. summary: Known for his role as a timid coder on 'Silicon Valley,' Mr. Nanjiani is seizing the moment to explore projects, like 'Little America' for Apple TV+. title: Court Dismisses Lawsuit Alleging Trump Unconstitutionally Profits From Presidency
summary: Maryland and D.C. lack standing to sue over emoluments claim, three-judge panel rules. A federal appeals court on Wednesday threw out a lawsuit alleging that President Trump's ownership of private companies that accept foreign-government business violates the U.S. Constitution.

title: Lab Startup uBiome Laying Off About Half of Global Workforce
summary: Major layoffs at lab-testing startup uBiome, which has been struggling since the FBI searched offices to probe billing practices. Lab-testing startup uBiome Inc. is laying off around half its global workforce today, the latest sign of turmoil at the company, which is under federal investigation for its billing practices.

title: 'Ragnar Kjartansson: Death Is Elsewhere' Review: A Mesmeric Midsummer Night
summary: Icelandic artist Ragnar Kjartansson's new video installation at the Met is a lush, ambiguous meditation on the relentless passage of time..

summary: June decline was the 12th in a row as the market suffers its first protracted slowdown after decades of growth. SHANGHAI-Major car makers are struggling in China as a slowing economy depresses sales of new vehicles and prolongs a yearlong downturn in the world's largest auto market after three decades of growth.

summary: Facebook, Google, Uber and Amazon embrace Manhattan as an East Coast hub. summary: Lawmakers on the Senate Commerce Committee voted along party lines, 14-12. Former senior Delta Air Lines Inc. executive Stephen Dickson is one step closer to taking over the embattled Federal Aviation Administration after a Senate committee approved his appointment on Wednesday.

title: Fed Saw Strengthening Case for Rate Cuts Last Month, Minutes Show
summary: By the time officials met in June, they judged that the risks of weaker growth had shifted notably. WASHINGTON-Federal Reserve officials grew more concerned about the economic outlook last month and discussed reasons why lower interest rates might be warranted in the coming months, according to minutes of their June meeting released Wednesday.

title: In Vienna, a Villa Built for a Brewing Bigwig
summary: Resume Subscription. In the twilight years of the Habsburg Empire, octogenarian emperor Franz Joseph stood for tradition, while the innovative painter Gustav Klimt, then in his prime, stood for progress. The two would seem to have little in common other than living in Vienna, but they both figure in the story of a local mansion, built for a member of a brewing dynasty.

title: GE Union Workers Reject Labor Deal
summary: Union leaders say workers declined to approve the contract, likely sending the two sides back to the bargaining table. General Electric Co. workers voted against a new four-year contract, surprising the conglomerate and union leaders who had negotiated the agreement last month and likely sending them back to the bargaining table.

title: The Throwback Looking to Serve Up a Wimbledon Upset
summary: The 33-year-old, who faces Serena Williams in the final four, is a throwback serve-and-volley expert. WIMBLEDON, England-At Wimbledon, the women's semifinals on Thursday will feature four players with four contrasting game styles. Serena Williams, a veteran at age 37, has her monster serve and 23 Grand Slam titles. Simona Halep, 27, can run and defend for miles. Elina Svitolina, 24, hits big and moves forward when she has a chance.

title: To Hit Its Targets, Fed May Light a Fire Under Stock Prices
summary: By easing when stock prices are high and unemployment is low, the Fed risks creating more problems down the road. The Federal Reserve is nervous enough about the economy to cut interest rates. By the time it stops worrying, stock prices could be so high that they present a whole new problem for the central bank to worry about.

title: Biden Used Tax-Code Loophole Obama Tried to Plug
summary: Former vice president structured his speaking, writing business in a way that cut his tax bill. Democratic presidential candidate Joe Biden used a tax loophole that the Obama administration tried and failed to close, substantially lowering his tax bill.

summary: Richard Branson's Virgin Galactic will be the first publicly traded space-tourism company, but not the most attractive. title: Fossil Suggests Earliest Known Movement of Humans Out of Africa
summary: Ancient skull bone was overlooked for nearly 40 years. An ancient skull bone unearthed in Greece, overlooked for decades in an Athens museum, may be the earliest known evidence of modern humans outside Africa, a new study says.

title: Jackie Kennedy's Favorite Earrings Are Back
summary: As the multiple-piercing look starts to litter Instagram, consider the refreshingly old-school allure of a classic disc. COCO CHANEL was rarely photographed without them. Socialite Babe Paley and first lady Jackie Kennedy also adopted the style. Button earrings-often round, typically embellished, designed to sit right on the earlobe-completed many women's uniform for much of the mid-20th century. Decades later, as hoop earrings reach ubiquity, buttons feel fresh again, reflecting a renewed appreciation for older jewelry. It's enough to make you rummage through your grandmother's trinket box to find a vintage pair.

title: Did Perot Spoil 1992 Election for Bush? It's Complicated.

summary: Resume Subscription. PG&E Corp. knew for years that hundreds of miles of high-voltage power lines could fail and spark fires, yet it repeatedly failed to perform the necessary upgrades.

title: When Pregnancies and Bigger Jobs Go Hand in Hand
summary: Women are winning leadership roles while expecting: 'I never turn down an opportunity'. Many women figure that expecting a better job while expecting a baby remains a far-fetched fantasy. Yet mothers-to-be are putting themselves up for promotions and getting hired into leadership across technology, media, restaurants, banking and advertising.

title: American Airlines Raises Revenue Expectations
summary: Airline sees profit hit of roughly $185 million related to grounding of Boeing 737 MAX fleet. American Airlines Group Inc. raised its unit revenue expectations for the second quarter due to fuller flights and said it will take a roughly $185 million profit hit related to the grounding of its Boeing 737 MAX fleet.

title: Some Democrats Fear 2020 Impact of Harris-Biden Spat
summary: Bickering between two top presidential rivals brought a public fight to an otherwise so-far peaceful contest. MYRTLE BEACH, S.C.-The clash between Sen. Kamala Harris and former Vice President Joe Biden over busing injected a new pugilism to the 2020 Democratic presidential contest. Two weeks on, it has also sparked some jitters about its impact on the race.

title: Tim Armstrong Makes Marketing Play to Serve Consumer Brands
summary: Former AOL boss chases direct-to-consumer startups' budgets with new venture called Unbox. Former AOL chief Tim Armstrong is joining the chase for direct-to-consumer brands' marketing budgets with a new venture called Unbox that will help DTC companies hawk their products.

title: Cheetah Digital Buys Wayin in Play for More Direct Data on Consumers
summary: So-called first-party data is becoming more attractive as privacy concerns grow. Direct-marketing firm Cheetah Digital has acquired Wayin Inc., a company which enables marketers to collect consumer information from quizzes and other interactive games, as demand for so-called first-party data grows.

title: Amazon's Alexa Will Provide U.K. Users With Medical Information
summary: Partnership with Britain's National Health Service will allow Alexa to offer data about common illnesses. LONDON- Amazon.com Inc.'s voice assistant Alexa will provide users in Britain with medical information from the country's National Health Service, in a deal that broadens the tech giant's push into health care but has privacy advocates worried about the possible misuse of such information.

title: Republicans Pin Hopes of Funding Deal on Pelosi-Mnuchin Talks
summary: Congress faces a series of deadlines to avoid a default on the government's debt and a government shutdown this fall. Senate Republicans are counting on two people to help them resolve a tangle of spending challenges before the fall: House Speaker Nancy Pelosi and Treasury Secretary Steve Mnuchin.

title: A Mammoth Problem Emerges in Siberia
summary: Resume Subscription. YAKUTSK, Russia-Brimming with pride, Sergei Fyodorov described the discovery of what many in this frigid Siberian outpost consider the find of the century-a perfectly preserved woolly mammoth that had been encased in ice for 28,000 years.

title: A Record Expansion's Surprise Winners: The Low-Skilled
summary: As unemployment remains near generation lows, the fortunes of low-wage workers have improved markedly. For years, falling wages and high unemployment seemed proof that low-wage workers needed an entirely new set of skills to succeed in an economy shaped by technological change and globalization.

title: Schools Wrestle With Privacy of Digital Data Collected on Students
summary: The online data collected on students is a complicated new front in the privacy battle. For Maryland lawyer Bradley Shear, his push to protect the data privacy of children became an obsession three years ago when his son, who was in the second grade, was accused by a teacher of googling a profane song in class.

title: Why an Airline Stock Suddenly Lost Altitude
summary: Analysts blamed the market kerfuffle on human error-in this case a so-called 'fat finger' incident. Even among stocks as infamous for rapid altitude changes as airlines, a drop of 40% stands out.

title: Big Tech Is a Likely Target at White House Social-Media Summit
summary: Guest list includes some critics of social-media platforms, but not Facebook or Twitter. WASHINGTON-A "Social Media Summit" at the White House this week will offer a platform for supporters of President Trump who say they face censorship by left-tilting Big Tech-and a preview of a likely theme in Mr. Trump's re-election campaign.

title: New Gambling Dens Are a Problem for Beijing
summary: Capital is flowing out of China via casinos in neighboring countries, and Beijing may not turn a blind eye indefinitely. From Manila to Vladivostok, China's gamblers have plenty of new places to play. But Beijing may not turn a blind eye indefinitely.

title: North Korea's Weapons Program Fuels Tokyo's Trade Spat With Seoul
summary: Accusations by Japan, which South Korea denies, have widened a diplomatic rift between the two U.S. allies. TOKYO-A contentious accusation underpins a trade dispute between Japan and South Korea: Chemicals and equipment bought by South Korean companies from Japan may be helping North Korea build weapons of mass destruction.

title: Doctor Visits Could Provide Relief to Uber and Lyft
summary: Ride-hailers are attempting to reach elderly and low-income riders through health-care providers, but it is unclear how big the opportunity is. Uber and Lyft have long been competing to take riders to work, to the movies or to the airport. Increasingly, they also are jockeying for the chance to give patients subsidized rides to the doctor's office.

title: Rip Torn, Theater, TV and Movie Actor, Dies at 88
summary: A native of Texas, he won an Emmy as the bombastic TV producer in 'The Larry Sanders Show'. LOS ANGELES- Rip Torn, the free-spirited Texan who overcame his quirky name to become a distinguished actor in theater, television and movies and win an Emmy in his 60s for his comedy turn on TV's "The Larry Sanders Show," has died. He was 88.

title: Stocks to Watch: AngioDynamics, Wynn, Levi Strauss, T-Mobile
summary: T-Mobile US will replace Red Hat in the S&P 500 following the completion of IBM's acquisition of Red Hat. Here are some of the companies with shares expected to trade actively in Wednesday's session. Stock movements noted by ticker reflect movements during regular trading hours; premarket trading is specified separately.

title: Flood of New Jets Will Create Turbulence
summary: Race to build smaller long-range planes could weigh on the aircraft-finance industry. After years of getting crowded with small planes and big planes, the skies are about to be invaded by medium-sized planes. The shift may delight airlines and flyers, but is starting to create problems for plane owners.

title: Powell Testimony to Be Watched Closely for Clues on Rates
summary: Will the central bank cut interest rates? Fed chairman has the opportunity to reset or ratify expectations. With bond markets betting that the Federal Reserve is likely to cut interest rates at its July 30-31 meeting, Chairman Jerome Powell has a prime opportunity to either reset or ratify those expectations during two days of testimony on Capitol Hill starting Wednesday.

title: U.K. Regulator on Why It Is Pursuing Record Fines Against BA, Marriott
summary: Companies had fundamental security flaws, says Information Commissioner Elizabeth Denham; their size and number of people affected also played a role. BRUSSELS-U.K. Information Commissioner Elizabeth Denham said her office considered cybersecurity gaps, among other factors, in proposing that Marriott International Inc. and British Airways ' parent company pay the biggest fines to date under Europe's data-privacy laws.

title: Rifts Emerge Over Congressional Move to Curb Surprise Medical Bills
summary: Bipartisan support broadly exists, but disagreements center on whether hospitals or doctors should take a financial hit and how to settle disputes. A Congressional plan to tackle surprise medical bills is spurring a furious lobbying campaign and disagreements among Republican lawmakers that could make it difficult to pass the legislation this month.

title: Newbies Pay $15 Million for TV Episode to Stand Out in Packed Streaming Market
summary: Newcomers are hoping to convince subscribers that their offerings are worth paying for in market dominated by Netflix, HBO and Hulu. LOS ANGELES-As Walt Disney Co., AT&T Inc.'s WarnerMedia and Apple Inc. prepare to enter the crowded streaming-entertainment market, they are racing to stand out with eye-catching shows that cost as much for a season as a big-budget movie.

title: A Nightmare Summer for American Airlines
summary: Labor tension plus lousy weather have meant higher rates of delays and cancellations for the largest U.S. carrier. A federal judge ordered lawyers for American Airlines and its mechanics union to meet in person over an alleged work slowdown, but American's top two attorneys didn't show.

title: Deflation Stalks Chinese Industry Again
summary: Producer price inflation hit zero in June for the first time since 2016. Right now, it's a great time to be selling pork into China. It's a bad time to be selling just about anything else-and a very bad time to be a Chinese central banker.

title: China Producer Prices Stall, Adding to Industry Woes
summary: Index continues a slide toward deflation as sluggish demand, falling commodities prices eat into company profits. BEIJING-Prices charged by China's producers were flat last month, continuing a slide toward deflation as sluggish demand and falling commodities prices eat into Chinese company profits.

title: U.S. Investigating Deutsche Bank's Dealings With Malaysian Fund
summary: Justice Department looking into whether German bank violated foreign corruption or anti-money-laundering laws. The sprawling, multibillion-dollar Malaysian development fraud scandal that has toppled a prime minister and stretched from Hollywood to Wall Street is threatening to implicate another major global financial institution: Deutsche Bank AG .

title: Pepper...and Salt
summary: Resume Subscription. We are delighted that you'd like to resume your subscription.

title: Greg Murphy Wins North Carolina GOP Congressional Primary Runoff
summary: Republican super PACs spent over $1 million to support rival Joan Perry, one of the party's few women candidates. The conservative House Freedom Caucus is one step closer to gaining another member as North Carolina state Rep. Greg Murphy defeated political newcomer Joan Perry on Tuesday in a primary runoff for an open congressional seat.

title: 'Friends' to Move to HBO Max, WarnerMedia's New Streaming Service
summary: Set to launch next spring, service will offer original content including projects from Reese Witherspoon, Anna Kendrick. WarnerMedia's new direct-to-consumer service will be the exclusive streaming home of the classic sitcom "Friends" as well as more than a dozen original shows and movies, as the entertainment giant sharpens its strategy to take on Netflix Inc.

title: Protesters Say Hong Kong Leader Must Do More
summary: Chief Executive Carrie Lam's assurances on legislation draw criticism for not going far enough. HONG KONG-Opponents of Hong Kong Chief Executive Carrie Lam vowed further protests, dealing a setback to her attempt to quash unrest sparked by a bill that would legalize extradition to China.

title: Mexico Finance Minister Resigns After Clashes With President; Peso Falls
summary: Surprise departure deepens doubts among investors over economic policy under leftist Andrés Manuel López Obrador. MEXICO CITY-Finance Minister Carlos Urzúa resigned, a surprise departure that deepened doubts among investors over economic policy under President Andrés Manuel López Obrador, including fears he may eventually undermine Mexico's financial stability.

title: Acosta Defends Handling of Epstein Case as Democrats Seek Resignation
summary: Labor secretary comes under fire for role in plea deal with financier accused of sexual trafficking involving underage girls. WASHINGTON-Labor Secretary Alexander Acosta defended his handling of a case involving a financier accused of exploiting underage girls, in the face of calls from top Democrats that he resign since he oversaw the matter while he was a federal prosecutor.
